intro: Blotiella bouxiniana, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters of yellowish-orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Blotiella bouxiniana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
